job_title: Student Worker in University Center, MI
pros: They were good at managing a work schedule that balanced school and classes. They allowed me to work on classwork in my off time.
cons: Honestly, there weren't any. I loved working here.

job_title: Professor in University Center, MI
pros: Staff cares about students and their success.
cons: Executive leadership created a negative environment, but new president may change it.

job_title: Assistant Professor in University Center, MI
pros: Nice people and supportive environment
cons: The agenda of a few drives the policy for many

job_title: Administrative Assistant in University Center, MI
pros: Great culture and teamwork! Delta is a socially responsible organization.
cons: Did not have full time employment.

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in University Center, MI
pros: I love working here. The folks I work with are wonderful.
cons: Leadership has been consistently changing making it difficult to find stability and know expectations.

job_title: Preschool Teacher in Stockton, CA
pros: Best preschool ever. Love it.
cons: There is none that applies.

job_title: Librarian in University Center, MI
pros: Laid back atmosphere, friendly community
cons: Beurocratic, not flexible, otherwise fine

review_title: Generally good work environment, but office politics might wear you down.
job_title: in University Center, MI
pros: Work atmosphere is fairly relaxed. Coworkers are friendly. Work/life balance is important and the school as a whole is willing to work with everyone to achieve  this.
cons: Office politics are rampant. Academic divisions actively work to undermine each other to make their own programs look better. Departments are entrenched, and extremely opposed to change. Lack of strong leadership has lead to a widespread culture of mediocrity.

review_title: Politically corrupt, scandalous and stressful work environment
job_title: Middle Student Services Manager in University Center, MI
pros: For the most part faculty care about their students and the quality of their curriculum and the classroom experience. Most of my colleagues were enjoyable to work with. The college has a sizable budget, so it isn't exactly lacking in resources. The medical benefits are almost completely paid by the college, so very cheap for employees and excellent in quality.
cons: The administrators of this college have hidden agendas. This may be generally true everywhere (and in my experience it is), but at THIS college these hidden agendas are littered with corruption and scandal. Many in upper management lack proper qualifications for their positions and the college suffers for it. The faculty and administration are constantly at war. Poor budgetary regulation, nepotism, favoritism, manipulation, passive-aggressive communications, lack of accountability and staff who are beyond retirement years add to the complications of working here.

review_title: Great Opportunity for a Rewarding Career
job_title: Office Assistant in University Center, MI
pros: Delta Colelge is very fair in hiring a diverse group of employees.  Everyone is very friendly and on a first name basis.  The communication between the board, managers and communities is amazing.  It’s a very transparent place to you and if you’re left in the dark it is your own fault.
cons: Some of the politics become old after a while.  It’s a necessary evil. The only other big thing is that any changes in the college take forever to take effect. Some manager can be micro managers.

job_title: Supervisor in University Center, MI
pros: Relatively low stress with decent benefits, allows me to pay some of my bills. It sounds really good on a resume to be working for Delta. If you're just looking for a job you can punch in and punch out at without taking it home this will be a great role for you.
cons: Absolutely no upward movement. Suggestions get thrown out the window. Extremely strict hours to avoid paying health insurance and other benefits. Students and community members seem to be ruder than most around here.

review_title: An excellent place to make a difference and grow professionally
job_title: Middle Manager in University Center, MI
pros: Outstanding opportunities for advancement and growth. Very safe and positive environment. Dedicated to student success through innovation and fairly high tolerance for pedagogical experimentation and invention. Student services is consistently cited by students as being the standard bearer among other area colleges and universities.
cons: Budget constraints and tight times have required that we do more with less. If someone hasn't been promoted, their pay has not increased with inflation or insurance contribution increases. But that's it!

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in University Center, MI
pros: Supportive work environment for full and part-time faculty members, which promotes professional development and lifelong learning experiences through funding of conference registrations, tuition, and the like. Excellent, relaxed work atmosphere too with friendly co-workers.
cons: Like any academic institution, there are administrative and departmental politics that can sometimes make the environment somewhat competitive, but that is not necessarily a bad thing.

review_title: Good College, strives to be the best.
job_title: General Laborer in University Center, MI
pros: Good management, essentially good wages for the work. Reasonablet time off practices, low stress work environment.
cons: College can be inefficient with resources at times, promotons were hard to come by in the general laborer position. Often too much down time, you could have trouble staying busy during slow times of the year, which may lead to a disciplinary problem.

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in University Center, MI
pros:
Delta College seems to care about their employees.
Rural location means you are not fighting traffic to get to work.
The college is updating many areas and departments.
cons:
In the past, the IT Department has had some inadequacies, but it has been improving.
Rural location can be a negative if you prefer working in the city.
Ongoing remodeling/construction has created detours inside and outside the building.

job_title: Supervisor in Bay City, MI
pros: The job through the work study program gave me knowledge of automotive tools. I enjoyed working with the knowledgeable  automotive instructors at delta college. I observed hands on mechanical work  by watching students in the automotive lab.
cons: The building got cold at times.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse Instructor in Slidell, LA
pros: 20+ years of nursing experience. ACLS /ONS certified.Working in infusion therapy I/m very comfortable w/ phlebotomy/patient care/IV therapy
cons: Delta was a teaching position that I enjoyed but lacked the hands on experience that I was used to. When enrollment went down your job was in jepardy

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in University Center, MI
pros: Helping a real mix of different folks reach for their goals.
cons: Low pay, Long hours.  Low cost to provide education drives inadequate compensation and over use of part time adjuncts.

job_title: in Bay City, MI
pros:
-My tuition was half off
-The coworkers and managers were cool people
-Tasks were well defined and easily achievable within the 4 hour shift.
cons: The work was somewhat boring at times.

job_title: Adjunct Instructor of History in University Center, MI
pros: Great students, great colleagues!  When I was at school here, I wanted to "grow up" to teach here, and now I do!
cons: Very few cons - adjuncts are not unionized.

review_title: Tech positions at Delta College (through Ellucian)
job_title: Tier I Tech Support in University Center, MI
pros: Works around school, positive interactions with faculty, students, and staff.
cons: Very political, low wages and lousy hours.

job_title: Work-Study in Univ Ctr, MI
pros: Amazing sense of community and community involvement
cons: Some inter office politics, nothing unusual

job_title: Anonymous Employee in University Center, MI
pros: Warm. welcoming, and friendly staff
cons: Large organization which seems disjointed at times.

job_title: Instructor in University Center, MI
pros: Faculty co-workers are wonderful
cons: The relationship and communication between faculty and administrators is deteriorating

job_title: Anonymous Employee in University Center, MI
pros: Flexible schedule and great atmosphere
cons: Not much room for growth

review_title: Not as good as they make it sound.
job_title: Nursing Lab in University Center, MI
pros: There are no pros to working for Delta College
cons: Too many people who think they are in charge.
